discussion.content:
Answer is System.Data.DataTable , everytime we use data scraping the variable type is DataTable.
"all the scraped information is stored in a DataTable variable"
https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2023.4/user-guide/about-data-scraping
System.data.DataTable
es la C
System.data.DataTable
When we do data scraping, output result always comes up in datatable format.

questions.question_text: A developer has built a process consisting of three invoked workflows in the Main.xaml file. The second workflow should be run in Picture-in-Picture (PiP). How should the Invoke Workflow File activity properties be configured?

discussion.content: Selected Answer: D If you check out only the .xaml file of a library project from the TFS repository, the .screenshots folder does not update. Use Get Latest Version on the folder to get the files.

Selected Answer: D
Get Latest Version , check in does not give you latest version but just prevents others from making changes in the code that you are working on. It is like locking up

questions.question_text: You are working on a project with three other developers and are using Team Foundation Server (TFS) source control in UiPath Studio. If you want to ensure you have the newest version from the server on your local machine, which TFS command should be used?

choices.A: Project was not properly checked out in Studio and merge failed into the master.
choices.D: Local version was not connected to any branch.
choices.C: Opened project was disconnected from the source control.
choices.B: Local repository is not synchronized with the remote one.

discussion.content: Ans : B

Selected Answer: B
https://forum.uipath.com/t/what-does-the-current-branch-is-out-of-date-mean/263715/2

Selected Answer: B
This means that the local repository is not synchronized with the remote one.

Click the Overwrite remote content button to push the local versions of files to the remote repository and overwrite the files there.

Click the Pull (rebase) button to pull the remote files and rebase the current branch.

Click the Cancel button to discard the whole operation.

Selected Answer: B
https://forum.uipath.com/t/what-does-the-current-branch-is-out-of-date-mean/263715
